com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector

Class VideoFileDetector

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector.Detector
      • com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.detector.VideoFileDetector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.decoder.FrameDecoder.DecoderFinishedListener, com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.decoder.FrameDecoder.DecoderFrameListener

    public class VideoFileDetector
extends Detector
implements com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.decoder.FrameDecoder.DecoderFrameListener, com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.decoder.FrameDecoder.DecoderFinishedListener
    A Detector for processing video files. An object of this class should be instantiated and run on a separate thread. Starting VideoFileDetector on the main Android UI thread, or any other looper-based thread, will cause the video decoding process to throw an exception.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoFileDetector

        public VideoFileDetector(android.content.Context context,
                 String filePath,
                 int maxNumFaces,
                 Detector.FaceDetectorMode faceDetectorMode)
        Creates a VideoFileDetector.
        Parameters:
        context - application's context.
        filePath - the path on the SD card to the video file.
        maxNumFaces - The maximum number of faces that the system should try to track. This may slow down the system.
        faceDetectorMode - A flag to specify if the system is tracking large (up close) or small (farther away) faces. Possible values are Detector.FaceDetectorMode.LARGE_FACES or Detector.FaceDetectorMode.SMALL_FACES.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if context and/or filePath is null.

      • VideoFileDetector

        public VideoFileDetector(android.content.Context context,
                 String filePath)
        Creates a VideoFileDetector.
        Parameters:
        context - application's context.
        filePath - the path on the SD card to the video file.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if context and/or filePath is null.

        Initiates processing of the video file.
        Overrides:

        Throws:
        LicenseException - if no or invalid license was provided see: Detector.setLicensePath(String).

      • frameReady

        public void frameReady(byte[] frame,
              int width,
              int height,
              Frame.COLOR_FORMAT format,
              long timeStamp,
              Frame.ROTATE rotation)
        Description copied from interface: com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.decoder.FrameDecoder.DecoderFrameListener
        Called when the Decoder gets a frame ready decoded and ready to process. You can go ahead and copy the ByteBuffer to a preallocated Bitmap (by calling copyPixelsFromBuffer on the Bitmap)
        Specified by:
        frameReady in interface com.affectiva.android.affdex.sdk.decoder.FrameDecoder.DecoderFrameListener
        Parameters:
        frame - The frame.
        format - the frame's color format.
        timeStamp - The frame's timestamp, in microseconds.
        rotation - The orientation of the passed frame.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Allows the VideoFileProcessor to deallocate resources when processing is complete.
        Overrides:
        stop in class Detector
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called before Detector.start().
        See Also:
        Detector.getPercentFaceDetected()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Detector
        Resets the baselines used to measure facial expressions and emotions. Can be called at any time, but will not have any effect before calling Detector.start().
        Overrides:
        reset in class Detector
